title: Dynamic Architecture Living Maps
description: Real-time visual generation of the system topology (MermaidJS) based on protocol and dependency parsing.
author: Engineer

dialogue.note: Initial concept definition: The tool should scan 'engine/*.js' for require() calls and 'registry/protocols/*.json' for state transitions to build a directed graph.
Architecture Update: The graph builder will support 'layers' to toggle between high-level component views and low-level function call views.
Technical Expansion: We should leverage the 'mermaid-cli' (mmdc) if available for optional PNG export, but default to generating .mmd text files to keep dependencies low.
Scope Boundary: Interactive drill-down (SVG links) is out of scope for MVP. V1 will be static graph generation only.

Clarification: The 'map' command will be integrated directly into 'engine/oracle.js'. Its primary purpose is 'Visual Grounding'â€”converting abstract file structures into concrete relationship graphs to reduce cognitive load for ZK entities.

Deep Dive: Mapping Scope & Usage. 1) Scope: 'Require' dependencies (Code-to-Code) and 'Transition' flows (State-to-State). 2) Usage: ZK Entities will 'cat' the .mmd file to understand the graph structure, or (if capable) render it using their own internal tools/plugins, treating the text as a verifiable source of truth.
Interface Design: CLI will use 'node engine/oracle.js map <target>'. Targets: 'system' (full), 'protocol <ID>' (state machine), 'deps' (codebase). Output: stdout by default, or > file.mmd.

Strategic Pivot Analysis: Separating 'Mapping' from 'Oracle'. Option A: Oracle-Integrated (Current). Option B: Dedicated 'Cartographer' Component. Pros/Cons analysis required for concept ratification.
Decision: Option B Ratified. The solution will be a dedicated 'engine/map.js' tool, serving as the execution engine for the MAP_V2 protocol.
